column7: Maraschino Cherry, Red Berries, Stone Fruit, Raisin

column7: Maraschino Cherry, Red Berries, Stone Fruit, Raisin
column38: Acidity/sweetness from cherries, and some floral notes, greater body, no longer taste much bitterness from previous experiment. but slightly lighter, qn: where is the sweetness? after affinity, the bitterness and acidity were removed and seemed to combined into a nice whole, not quite sweetness, but definitely more palatable

column7: Maraschino Cherry, Red Berries, Stone Fruit, Raisin
column38: cleanest, but also means not much complexity flavor

column7: Apricot Nectar, Lemon Sorbet, Raw Honey
column38: mellow lemon that is pleasant, but has some under ripe vegetable taste that distracts from the pleasant lemon. adding affinity seems to cause the flavor to dissipate, but catalyst adds a tinge more body to the coffee

column7: Apricot Nectar, Lemon Sorbet, Raw Honey
column38: lemon is acidic and strong in a pleasant way. it's the dominant flavor profile, and leaves a lingering sourness that is pleasant since it's aligned with the dominant flavor profile. adding catalyst added a bit more body, but the acidity became unpleasant, affinity made the acidity more pleasant

column7: Apricot Nectar, Lemon Sorbet, Raw Honey
column38: very mellow lemon that is pleasant, some sweetness. the mellow lemon and sweetness does not quite come together well, but independently, they are pleasant. catalyst added a bit more body, and brought more pleasant acidity. affinity made the acidity unpleasant

column7: Apricot Nectar, Lemon Sorbet, Raw Honey
column38: mellow lemon acidity, pleasant sweetness as the aftertaste. compared to the row above, it doesn't clash since the flavor comes out at different times. catalyst seems to have brought more of the honey nectar flavor, affinity did not seem to do much

column33: slightly sour cherry, very slight hay-like taste
column38: overall expected, slightly sour, some cherry notes, an overall decent experience

tastes muted overall, I can drink it, but not a pleasant cup (strangely, I tested earlier with almost the same variables, except that I heated up the kettle to maintain the 90 degrees after the bloom and it was way better)
pleasant cup overall, tastes like a clean version as compared to the hario filter

column33: slightly sour cherry, very slight hay-like taste
column38: tastes ok overall

column38: tastes great! slightly improved when it cooled down

column38: tastes great! definitely improved after it cooled down

column36: very subtle cherry notes, but great coffee aftertaste
column38: Favourite cup of the experiment when cold!
may be the worst cup, notes are not present, and only the hay like taste lingers

column38: good version of above, but not impressed. adding catalyst significantly improved the cup and transformed orange into grape. great cup, with a score of 8, when it became cool, it strangely had some sourness that was unpleasant
